description: Daria Tomenko, reflecting on both Stenograd’s collective trauma and her brother’s disappearance, chooses to activate the protocol restoring all erased 'ghosts' to official records, overriding BCI constraints.

The restoration protocol executes. Formerly disappeared citizens are reintroduced into all civic systems, causing shockwaves through administrative offices and sparking confidential Council briefing on the city’s sudden demographic change.

The first families are reunited. News spreads as grassroots groups gather publicly to support and welcome returned residents, with emotional stories of loss, survival, and injustice circulating across local media.

District assemblies begin holding debates on the future of the BCI, with returned residents speaking about the impact of their erasure and advocating for a complete abolition of scoring and full justice.

After sustained marches and mounting public pressure for accountability and reparations, the Council suspends the BCI and announces citywide truth hearings to address the disappeared and redefine citizenship and justice.
